title: Time Zone Check
custom_preconds:
iOS Settings > General > Time Zone

http://www.timezonecheck.com/
custom_steps:
To test, it would be easy to have one device on current local time and then another one you change the Time Zone the below locations.

Please keep in mind to kill the app before switching Time Zones.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your iOS device to ET (NYC) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar
Team Page Schedule > List
Team Page > Transactions
Scoreboard
Game Preview
MLB.TV Grid
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings (Standings Current as of <>)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (ET)
and the data loads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your iOS device to CT (Chicago) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar 
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar
Team Page Schedule > List
Team Page > Transactions
Scoreboard
Game Preview
MLB.TV Grid
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings (Standings Current as of <>)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (CT)
and the data loads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your iOS device to MT (Salt Lake City) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar 
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar
Team Page Schedule > List
Team Page > Transactions
Scoreboard
Game Preview
MLB.TV Grid
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article

title: Time Zone Check
custom_preconds:
iOS Settings > General > Time Zone

http://www.timezonecheck.com/
custom_steps:
To test, it would be easy to have one device on current local time and then another one you change the Time Zone the below locations. Make sure the games fall on the same are consistent. Also for outside of the US, you might see Scoreboard game cell or game row show the day of the week if happen to fall on two days (Lisbon, London) or fall on next day (Australia).

Please keep in mind to kill the app before switching Time Zones.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your iOS device to ET (NYC) and check the following:

Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar
Team Page > Transactions
Gameday Top Overlay (with MLB.com logo and date picker)
Gameday Out of Town Scoreboard
MLB.TV Grid
Gameday Audio Grid
Scoreboard
News (Last Updated)
News Article Detail (Date on By Line)
Standings (Standings Current as of <>)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (ET) displayed
and the data loads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your iOS device to CT (Chicago) and check the following:

Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar
Team Page > Transactions
Gameday Top Overlay (with MLB.com logo and date picker)
Gameday Out of Town Scoreboard
MLB.TV Grid
Gameday Audio Grid
Scoreboard
News (Last Updated)
News Article Detail (Date on By Line)
Standings (Standings Current as of <>)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (CT) displayed
and the data loads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your iOS device to MT (Salt Lake City) and check the following:

Gameday Top Overlay (with MLB.com logo and date picker)
